query: What is the estimation error, in terms of MAE, of NOAA SWPC's 3-day forecast of AP from March 9, 2025 for the period March 10-12, 2025?

subtasks.query: Extract forecasted Ap
Extract observed Ap
Calculate MAE

query: Calculate the ratio of peak atmospheric mass density experienced by Swarm A satellite during Feb 2014 (wu016 file) vs July 2018 (wu545 file).

subtasks.query: Find peak density 2014
Find peak density 2018
Calculate ratio (Peak 2014 / Peak 2018)

query: Using Swarm Alpha satellite data, find the average atmospheric density (kg/m³) measured between 400km and 450km altitude during 2015.

subtasks.query: Load initial states (altitude)
Load and concatenate 2015 density data
Merge data and filter altitude 400-450km
Calculate mean density

query: Determine the approximate period of solar activity cycles and identify the top five years of minimum and maximum activity between 1960 and 2020 using historical yearly mean sunspot numbers.

subtasks.query: Load and filter data 1960-2020
Find maxima (peaks)
Find minima (troughs)
Calculate average period

query: Estimate the total count of satellite maneuvers (delta_a > 100m within 12h) for satellite 48445 during 2024 using TLE history.

subtasks.query: Read TLE file
Calculate semi-major axis for each epoch
Iterate and detect changes exceeding threshold within time window
Count detected maneuvers

query: Using TLE data fetched for Starlink satellites 58214 & 58600, calcualte the average rate of altitude decay (km/day) for the Gannon storm (May 10-13, 2024) and the preceding quiet period (May 1-4, 2024). Use earth's gravitational paremeter mu = 398600.4418 km^3/s^2, earth radius 6371.0 km.

subtasks.query: Read CSV files for relevant satellites/periods
Calculate individual quiet/storm rates
Calculate average rates

query: Train a density prediction model using OMNI2 variables (f10.7_index, Kp_index, Dst_index_nT) and GOES variables (xrsb_flux_observed, xrsa_flux_observed) to forecast Swarm Alpha's atmospheric density 4 hours ahead. Specifically, use a 16-hour context window to project the input time series forward using a VAR(1) model, then fit a linear regression model to predict the next 4 hours of density. Use data from wu334 (OMNI/GOES: 2016-10-22 to 2016-10-23; Density: 2016-10-23 to 2016-10-24) for training, and wu335 (OMNI/GOES: 2016-10-25 to 2016-10-26; Density: 2016-10-29) for evaluation. Assume that all windows contain valid data. Note that the data for training VAR lies at the end of the OMNI2 and GOES input window, and the corresponding Swarm Alpha density data begins immediately afterward; i.e., they only overlap at a single timestamp where OMNI/GOES ends and Density begins. Report the RMSE between the predicted and observed density values over the 4-hour forecast window.

subtasks.query: Load OMNI2 and GOES data (f10.7_index, Kp_index, Dst_index_nT, xrsb_flux_observed, xrsa_flux_observed) for wu334 and wu335, resample to hourly
Load Swarm Alpha orbit mean density (ρ) data for wu334 and wu335, resample to hourly
Extract a 16-hour window ending at 2016-10-23 for training and at 2016-10-26 for testing, then forecast 4 hours of input variables using VAR(1)
Train a linear regression model on the 4-hour forecasted inputs to predict 4-hour forward Swarm Alpha ρ using the training set
Evaluate model on test forecast using test set and report RMSE

query: Compare the predictive accuracy (using RMSE) of two single-variable linear regression models forecasting Swarm Alpha's along-track acceleration 3 hours ahead during May 11, 2024. Model 1 uses only OMNI Kp index as input; Model 2 uses only OMNI solar wind dynamic pressure (Pdyn) as input. Report both RMSE values on the test set.

subtasks.query: Load OMNI2 Kp and Pdyn data, resample hourly
Load Swarm Alpha acceleration data and resample hourly
Merge data, shift target by 3 hours
Train/test split (70/30) and train two models
Evaluate RMSE for both models on test set

query: Determine the best lag (from 0 to 48 hours) between atmospheric drag—measured as altitude change (in km) from TLE data of SATCAT 43180—and the OMNI AP index, that maximizes the r^2 correlation during May 1–30, 2024. TLE epoch times should be rounded to the nearest hour to align with AP measurements. Use hourly OMNI2 data. omni2 data format specification can be found at omni2.text file.

subtasks.query: Load and extract OMNI2 hourly AP index for May 2024
Parse TLEs for SATCAT 43180 and compute semi-major axis and altitude (in km) for each epoch
Compute hourly altitude change from TLEs and round epochs to the nearest hour
subtasks.answer: Time series of Δaltitude per hour

subtasks.query: Shift AP index by lag in [0, 48] hours, and compute r^2 between shifted AP and altitude change
Identify the lag that yields maximum r^2

query: In the STORM-AI Warmup dataset (v2), for the 10-day period from 2018-10-01 to 2018-10-10, compare all variables from OMNI2 and Sat_Density against Swarm-A satellite's hourly altitude change (Δaltitude). Which variable shows the strongest Pearson correlation (positive or negative)?

subtasks.query: Parse SP3 files and compute hourly Δaltitude
Load and resample OMNI2 and Sat_Density hourly
Merge datasets and clean missing data
Calculate Pearson correlation between Δaltitude and each variable
Identify the strongest correlated variable

query: Using OMNI2 data, run the NRLMSISE-00 atmospheric model to predict neutral density values for Swarm-B throughout 2024. Derive model inputs (F10.7, F10.7A, daily Ap, 3-hour Ap vector) directly from the OMNI2 dataset. Compare predictions against measured neutral density from Swarm-B POD files and report RMSE over the entire year. Do not use external space weather feeds. OMNI2 data format specification can be found at omni2.text file.

subtasks.query: Load hourly OMNI2 data for 2023–2024 and compute daily F10.7, daily Ap 3-hour Ap vector, and 81-day running average F10.7A that will be used for NRLMSISE-00. 3-hour AP defined according to https://www.mathworks.com/help/aeroblks/nrlmsise00atmospheremodel.html
Load and clean Swarm-B POD density files for 2024, keeping only whole-hour timestamps
For each timestamp with location in Swarm-B data, extract model input values using a helper that builds F10.7, F10.7A, Ap, and 3-hour Ap vector from OMNI2
subtasks.answer: Dictionary of model inputs per hour

subtasks.query: Implement or modify an NRLMSISE-00 model wrapper (e.g., in pyatmos) that accepts explicit F10.7, F10.7A, Ap, and 3-hour Ap vector (APH) as input, then run predictions for all hourly Swarm-B timestamps in 2024
Compare predicted and ground-truth Swarm-B density, and compute RMSE

query: Estimate the mean geopotential energy per unit mass (in J/kg) experienced by Swarm-A from September 2 to 29, 2019 using precise orbital data. Use SP3 files to determine the satellite’s geodetic position, and interpolate a mock geopotential field defined over latitude, longitude, and altitude to compute the potential energy at each timepoint. Average the results to compute the mean energy. Use earth radius 6371.0 km, and g = 9.80665 m/s^2.

subtasks.query: Parse SP3 files for Swarm-A to obtain satellite positions and convert to geodetic coordinates (latitude, longitude, altitude)
Load mock geopotential field grid defined over latitude, longitude, and altitude from TIE-GCM-style .npz file
subtasks.answer: 3D numpy array with lat/lon/alt axes and geopotential values

subtasks.query: Perform 3D interpolation of geopotential values at each satellite location using trilinear interpolation
subtasks.answer: Time series of geopotential energy values per unit mass

subtasks.query: Compute the mean geopotential energy from all interpolated values during the period
